trans-unit.source: Defines which query parameters the controller accepts. If you give the names ['category','page'] it will bind the values of these query parameters to the variables this.category and this.page. By default, Ember coerces query parameter values using toggleProperty. This behavior may lead to unexpected results. Available queryParam types: boolean, number, array. If query param type not specified, it will be string. To explicitly configure a query parameter property so it coerces as expected, you must define a type property:

Definition

Definition time can be expensive and only needs to happen once since it is an idempotent operation. For example, between test runs and FastBoot requests, the application stays the same. It is only the state that we want to reset.

Delay calling the target method until the debounce period has elapsed with no additional debounce calls. If debounce is called again before the specified time has elapsed, the timer is reset and the entire period must pass again before the target method is called.
trans-unit.target: 추가 디 바운스 호출없이 디 바운스 기간이 경과 할 때까지 대상 메소드 호출을 지연시킵니다. 경우 debounce 지정된 시간이 경과하기 전에 다시 호출, 타이머가 재설정되고 대상 메서드를 호출하기 전에 전체 기간을 다시 통과해야합니다.

Delete `postRecord.destroyRecord()`
Deleting Records

Deleting records is as straightforward as creating records. Call deleteRecord() on any instance of DS.Model. This flags the record as isDeleted. The deletion can then be persisted using save(). Alternatively, you can use the destroyRecord method to delete and persist at the same time.
trans-unit.target: 레코드를 삭제하는 것은 레코드를 작성하는 것만 큼 간단합니다. DS.Model 의 인스턴스에서 deleteRecord() 를 호출 하십시오 . 레코드를 isDeleted 로 플래그합니다 . 그런 다음 save() 사용하여 삭제를 지속 할 수 있습니다 . 또는 destroyRecord 메소드를 사용하여 동시에 삭제 및 지속 할 수 있습니다 .

trans-unit.source: Deleting records is as straightforward as creating records. Call deleteRecord() on any instance of Model. This flags the record as isDeleted. The deletion can then be persisted using save(). Alternatively, you can use the destroyRecord method to delete and persist at the same time.

Different apps may have very different models, depending on what problems they're trying to solve. For example, a photo sharing application might have a Photo model to represent a particular photo, and a PhotoAlbum that represents a group of photos. In contrast, an online shopping app would probably have different models, like ShoppingCart, Invoice, or LineItem.

trans-unit.source: Duration

During a route transition, the Ember Router passes a transition object to the various hooks on the routes involved in the transition. Any hook that has access to this transition object has the ability to immediately abort the transition by calling transition.abort(), and if the transition object is stored, it can be re-attempted at a later time by calling transition.retry().
trans-unit.target: 경로 전환 중에 Ember 라우터는 전환과 관련된 경로의 다양한 후크에 전환 객체를 전달합니다. 이 전환 객체에 액세스 할 수있는 모든 후크는 transition.abort() 를 호출하여 전환을 즉시 중단 할 수 있으며 전환 객체가 저장된 경우 transition.retry() 를 호출하여 나중에 다시 시도 할 수 있습니다. .

Dynamic Models
Dynamic Segments

Dynamic content inside a Handlebars expression is rendered with data-binding. This means if you update a property, your usage of that property in a template will be automatically updated to the latest value.

Each argument in the helper will be added to an array and passed to our helper. For example, {{my-helper "foo" "bar"}} would result in myHelper(["foo", "bar"]). Using array ES2015 destructuring assignment, we can name expected parameters within the array. In the example above, the first argument in the template will be assigned to propertyType. This provides a flexible, expressive interface for your helpers, including optional arguments and default values.
trans-unit.target: 헬퍼의 각 인수 는 배열에 추가되어 헬퍼에게 전달됩니다. 예를 들어 {{my-helper "foo" "bar"}} 는 myHelper(["foo", "bar"]) 됩니다. 배열 ES2015 소멸 할당을 사용하여 배열 내에서 예상되는 매개 변수의 이름을 지정할 수 있습니다. 위의 예제에서 템플릿의 첫 번째 인수는 propertyType 에 할당됩니다 . 이것은 선택적 인수와 기본값을 포함하여 도우미를위한 유연하고 표현적인 인터페이스를 제공합니다.

Each record has a currentState property that explicitly tracks what state a record is in at any given time. For instance, if a record is newly created and has not yet been sent to the adapter to be saved, it would be in the root.loaded.created.uncommitted state. If a record has had local modifications made to it that are in the process of being saved, the record would be in the root.loaded.updated.inFlight state. (This state paths will be explained in more detail below.)
trans-unit.target: 각 레코드에는 특정 시점의 레코드 상태를 명시 적으로 추적 하는 currentState 속성이 있습니다. 예를 들어, 레코드가 새로 작성되어 아직 어댑터로 전송되어 저장되지 않은 경우 레코드는 root.loaded.created.uncommitted 상태입니다. 레코드를 저장하는 중에 레코드를 로컬로 수정 한 경우 레코드는 root.loaded.updated.inFlight 상태가됩니다. (이 상태 경로는 아래에서 더 자세히 설명됩니다.)

Embedded records must have a model defined to be extracted and serialized. Note that when defining any relationships on your model such as belongsTo and hasMany, you should not both specify async: true and also indicate through the serializer's attrs attribute that the related model should be embedded for deserialization. If a model is declared embedded for deserialization (embedded: 'always' or deserialize: 'records'), then do not use async: true.
trans-unit.target: 임베드 된 레코드에는 추출 및 직렬화되도록 정의 된 모델이 있어야합니다. belongsTo 와 hasMany 와 같이 모델에 관계를 정의 할 때 async: true 지정하지 말고 시리얼 라이저의 attrs 속성을 통해 관련 모델이 직렬화 해제를 위해 포함되어야 함을 나타내야합니다. 역 직렬화를 위해 임베드 된 모델 ( embedded: 'always' 또는 deserialize: 'records' ) 로 선언 된 경우 async: true 사용하지 마십시오 .

Ember CLI by default uses Babel.js to allow you to use tomorrow's JavaScript, today.
trans-unit.target: Ember CLI는 기본적으로 Babel.js 를 사용하여 현재 내일의 JavaScript를 사용할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember CLI is built with JavaScript, and requires the most recent LTS version of the Node.js runtime. It also requires dependencies fetched via npm. npm is packaged with Node.js, so if your computer has Node.js installed you are ready to go.
trans-unit.target: Ember CLI는 JavaScript로 빌드되며 최신 LTS 버전의 Node.js 런타임이 필요합니다. 또한 npm을 통해 가져온 종속성이 필요합니다 . npm은 Node.js와 함께 패키지되어 있으므로 컴퓨터에 Node.js가 설치되어 있으면 바로 사용할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember CLI provides a common format called Ember Addons for distributing reusable libraries to solve some of these problems. Additionally, you may want to make use of front-end dependencies like a CSS framework or a JavaScript datepicker that aren't specific to Ember apps.

Ember CLI ships with support for managing your application's environment. Ember CLI will setup a default environment config file at config/environment. Here, you can define an ENV object for each environment, which are currently limited to three: development, test, and production.
trans-unit.target: Ember CLI는 애플리케이션 환경 관리를 지원합니다. Ember CLI는 config/environment 에 기본 환경 구성 파일을 설정합니다 . 여기서 각 환경에 대해 ENV 객체를 정의 할 수 있으며 현재 개발, 테스트 및 프로덕션의 세 가지로 제한됩니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember CLI specifically uses Babel via the ember-cli-babel plugin.
trans-unit.target: Ember CLI는 특히 ember-cli-babel 플러그인을 통해 Babel 을 사용합니다 .

trans-unit.source: Ember CLI uses Babel.js for the compile step in this process. If you've used Babel before, you know that it comes with a large set of options, including the ability to configure "targets"; i.e. the environments in which your application is expected to run. For example, if your application is embedded in an Electron app, you might only care about compiling for the latest Chromium build. Or if your app targets Enterprise users, you may need to compile your JavaScript to older syntax that runs in IE11.

Ember CLI uses ECMAScript 2015 (ES2015 for short or previously known as ES6) modules to organize application code. For example, the line import Ember from 'ember'; gives us access to the actual Ember.js library as the variable Ember. And the import config from './config/environment'; line gives us access to our app's configuration data as the variable config. const is a way to declare a read-only variable to make sure it is not accidentally reassigned elsewhere. At the end of the file, export default Router; makes the Router variable defined in this file available to other parts of the app.
trans-unit.target: Ember CLI는 ECMAScript 2015 (짧거나 이전에 ES6으로 알려진 ES2015) 모듈을 사용하여 응용 프로그램 코드를 구성합니다. 예를 들어, 라인 import Ember from 'ember'; 실제 Ember.js 라이브러리에 변수 Ember 로 액세스 할 수 있습니다. 그리고 import config from './config/environment'; line은 변수 config 로 앱의 구성 데이터에 액세스 할 수있게합니다 . const 는 읽기 전용 변수를 선언하여 실수로 다른 곳에 재할 당하지 않도록하는 방법입니다. 파일 끝에서 export default Router; 차종 Router 응용 프로그램의 다른 부분에 사용할 수있는이 파일에 정의 된 변수를.

trans-unit.source: Ember CLI will then generate a handful of files for our component:
trans-unit.target: 그러면 Ember CLI가 컴포넌트에 대한 몇 가지 파일을 생성합니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember CLI, Ember's command line interface, provides a standard project structure, a set of development tools, and an addon system. This allows Ember developers to focus on building apps rather than building the support structures that make them run. From your command line, a quick ember --help shows the commands Ember CLI provides. For more information on a specific command, type ember help <command-name>.
trans-unit.target: Ember의 명령 줄 인터페이스 인 Ember CLI는 표준 프로젝트 구조, 개발 도구 세트 및 애드온 시스템을 제공합니다. 이를 통해 Ember 개발자는 지원 구조를 구축하는 대신 앱 구축에 집중할 수 있습니다. 명령 행에서 빠른 ember --help 는 Ember CLI가 제공하는 명령을 보여줍니다. 특정 명령에 대한 자세한 내용을 보려면 ember help <command-name> 을 입력하십시오 .

trans-unit.target: Ember Data에는 모델이 서로 관련되는 방식을 정의하는 데 도움이되는 여러 가지 내장 관계 유형이 포함되어 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data injects the store service to every route and controller so that you can immediately write this.store! If you want to access the store in a component or another service, you will need to inject the store service.

Ember Data injects the store service to every route and controller so that you can immediately write this.store! If you want to access the store in a component or another service, you will need to inject the store service.

Ember Data is a powerful (but optional) library included by default in new Ember apps. In the next example, we will use Ember Data's findAll method, which returns a Promise, and resolves with an array of Ember Data records.

Ember Data is also designed to work with streaming servers, like those powered by WebSockets. You can open a socket to your server and push changes into Ember Data whenever they occur, giving your app a real-time user interface that is always up-to-date.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 또한 WebSocket에 의해 구동되는 것과 같은 스트리밍 서버와 작동하도록 설계되었습니다. 서버에 대한 소켓을 열고 변경이 발생할 때마다 변경 사항을 Ember Data로 푸시하여 앱에 항상 최신 상태 인 실시간 사용자 인터페이스를 제공 할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data is going to normalize the payload's root key for the modelName. As a result, it will try to look up the "blog/post" model. Since we don't have a model called "blog/post" (or a file called app/models/blog/post.js in ember-cli), Ember Data will throw an error because it cannot find the "blog/post" model.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 modelName에 대한 페이로드의 루트 키를 정규화하려고합니다. 결과적으로 "블로그 / 포스트"모델을 찾아 보려고합니다. "blog / post"라는 모델 (또는 ember-cli에 app / models / blog / post.js라는 파일)이 없기 때문에 Ember Data는 "blog / post"를 찾을 수 없기 때문에 오류를 발생시킵니다 모델.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data models are normally setup using the singular form (which is why we use `person` instead of `people` here)

Ember Data provides the ability to query for records that meet certain criteria. Calling store.query() will make a GET request with the passed object serialized as query params. This method returns a DS.PromiseArray in the same way as findAll.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 특정 기준에 맞는 레코드를 쿼리하는 기능을 제공합니다. store.query() 호출 하면 전달 된 객체가 쿼리 매개 변수로 직렬화되어 GET 요청 이 작성됩니다 . 이 메소드는 findAll 과 같은 방식으로 DS.PromiseArray 를 리턴합니다 .

trans-unit.source: Ember Data provides the ability to query for records that meet certain criteria. Calling store.query() will make a GET request with the passed object serialized as query params. This method returns a PromiseArray in the same way as findAll.
Ember Data requires you to define the structure of the data you wish to provide to your application by extending DS.Model.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data를 사용하려면 DS.Model 을 확장하여 응용 프로그램에 제공 할 데이터의 구조를 정의해야합니다 .

trans-unit.source: Ember Data resolves sync relationships with the related resources available in its local store, hence it is expected these resources to be loaded before or along-side the primary resource.

Ember Data ships with 3 serializers. The JSONAPISerializer is the default serializer and works with JSON API backends. The JSONSerializer is a simple serializer for working with single json object or arrays of records. The RESTSerializer is a more complex serializer that supports sideloading and was the default serializer before 2.0.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 3 개의 시리얼 라이저와 함께 제공됩니다. JSONAPISerializer 는 기본 시리얼과 JSON의 API 백엔드와 함께 작동합니다. JSONSerializer 는 단일 JSON 객체 또는 기록의 배열을 사용하기위한 간단한 시리얼입니다. RESTSerializer 가 지원하는 사이드 로딩 및 2.0 전에 기본 시리얼 것을 더 복잡한 시리얼입니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data ships with 3 serializers. The JSONAPISerializer is the default serializer and works with JSON:API backends. The JSONSerializer is a simple serializer for working with single JSON object or arrays of records. The RESTSerializer is a more complex serializer that supports sideloading and was the default serializer before 2.0.
Ember Data takes care of tracking the state of each record for you. This allows Ember Data to treat newly created records differently from existing records when saving.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 각 레코드의 상태를 추적합니다. 이를 통해 Ember Data는 새로 생성 된 레코드를 저장할 때 기존 레코드와 다르게 처리 할 수 ​​있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data uses the JSONAPISerializer by default, but you can override this default by defining a custom serializer. There are two ways to define a custom serializer. First, you can define a custom serializer for your entire application by defining an "application" serializer.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 기본적으로 JSONAPISerializer 를 사용 하지만 사용자 정의 serializer를 정의하여이 기본값을 무시할 수 있습니다. 커스텀 시리얼 라이저를 정의하는 두 가지 방법이 있습니다. 먼저 "응용 프로그램"직렬 변환기를 정의하여 전체 응용 프로그램에 대한 사용자 정의 직렬 변환기를 정의 할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data will do its best to discover which relationships map to one another. In the one-to-many code above, for example, Ember Data can figure out that changing the comments relationship should update the blogPost relationship on the inverse because blogPost is the only relationship to that model.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 어떤 관계가 서로 매핑되는지 알아 내기 위해 최선을 다할 것입니다. 예를 들어, 위의 일대 다 코드에서 Ember Data는 blogPost 가 해당 모델과의 유일한 관계 이기 때문에 comments 관계 를 변경 하면 반대 의 blogPost 관계를 업데이트해야 함 을 알 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data will do its best to discover which relationships map to one another. In the one-to-many code above, for example, Ember Data can figure out that changing the comments relationship should update the post relationship on the inverse because post is the only relationship to that model.
trans-unit.target: Ember Data는 어떤 관계가 서로 매핑되는지 알아 내기 위해 최선을 다할 것입니다. 예를 들어 위의 일대 다 코드에서 Ember Data는 post가 해당 모델과의 유일한 관계이기 때문에 comments 관계 를 변경 하면 역 의 post 관계를 업데이트해야 함 을 알 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Data's default Adapter has some built-in assumptions about how a REST API should look. If your backend conventions differ from those assumptions, Ember Data allows either slight adjustments or you can switch to a different adapter if your backend works noticeably differently.

Ember Data, included by default when you create a new application, is a library that integrates tightly with Ember to make it easy to retrieve models from your server as JSON, save updates back to the server, and create new models in the browser.
trans-unit.target: 새 응용 프로그램을 만들 때 기본적으로 포함되는 Ember Data는 Ember와 긴밀하게 통합되어 라이브러리에서 서버에서 모델을 쉽게 검색하고 업데이트를 서버에 다시 저장하며 브라우저에서 새 모델을 만들 수 있도록하는 라이브러리입니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember Engines
Ember Exam

Ember Exam also lets you randomize how the tests are run. Why would you want to do so? When you don't properly set up and tear down a test, you can create dependencies among tests. Randomizing the order helps you catch these inadvertent bugs.

trans-unit.source: Ember Inspector

Ember Inspector also provides deprecation handling capability. It can work complimentary to ember-cli-deprecation-workflow. As you unsilence deprecations to fix them, the inspector can allow you to more quickly find where in your code a deprecation occurs when you run into it at runtime, reducing the amount of stack trace browsing you have to do. For more information on using deprecation handling in Ember Inspector, see its guides section.
trans-unit.target: Ember Inspector는 또한 지원 중단 처리 기능을 제공합니다. ember-cli-deprecation-workflow에 무료로 작동 할 수 있습니다. 더 이상 사용되지 않는 폐기를 수정하기 위해 검사기를 사용하면 런타임에 코드가 폐기 될 때 코드에서 더 이상 사용되지 않는 위치를 더 빨리 찾을 수 있으므로 스택 추적 찾아보기의 양을 줄일 수 있습니다. Ember Inspector에서 지원 중단 처리 사용에 대한 자세한 내용은 안내서 섹션을 참조하십시오 .

trans-unit.source: Ember application builds are created by the Ember CLI build pipeline. Just as with your application code, Ember CLI ships with a sensible set of defaults to compile and bundle the assets that can be deployed to production. Under the hood, this is accomplished using a series of Broccoli plugins, each of which can be configured in the ember-cli-build.js file at the root of your project.
Ember applications utilize the dependency injection ("DI") design pattern to declare and instantiate classes of objects and dependencies between them.

Ember applications utilize the dependency injection ("DI") design pattern to declare and instantiate classes of objects and dependencies between them. Applications and application instances each serve a role in Ember's DI implementation.
trans-unit.target: Ember 응용 프로그램은 종속성 주입 ( "DI") 디자인 패턴을 사용하여 개체 클래스와 개체 간 종속성을 선언하고 인스턴스화합니다. 애플리케이션과 애플리케이션 인스턴스는 각각 Ember의 DI 구현에서 역할을합니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember components are commonly tested with component integration tests. Component integration tests verify the behavior of a component within the context of Ember's rendering engine. When running in an integration test, the component goes through its regular render lifecycle, and has access to dependent objects, loaded through Ember's resolver.
trans-unit.target: Ember 구성 요소는 일반적으로 구성 요소 통합 테스트를 통해 테스트 됩니다. 컴포넌트 통합 테스트는 Ember의 렌더링 엔진 컨텍스트 내에서 컴포넌트의 동작을 검증합니다. 통합 테스트에서 실행될 때 구성 요소는 일반 렌더 수명주기 를 거치며 Ember의 리졸버를 통해로드 된 종속 객체에 액세스 할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember components represent state to the UI of an application. Further reading on components can be found under Component.
Ember components represent state to the UI of an application. Further reading on components can be found under Ember.Component.
trans-unit.target: Ember 구성 요소는 응용 프로그램의 UI에 대한 상태를 나타냅니다. 구성 요소에 대한 자세한 내용은 Ember.Component 아래를 참조하십시오 .

trans-unit.source: Ember considers testing a first-class citizen. In addition to providing easy paths to integrate QUnit and Mocha, Ember supports a variety of addons and debugging tools to improve your developer experience in testing.

Ember detects the changed file and automatically reloads the page for you in the background. You should see that the welcome page has been replaced by "PeopleTracker". You also added an {{outlet}} to this page, which means that any nested route will be rendered in that place.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 변경된 파일을 감지하고 백그라운드에서 자동으로 페이지를 다시로드합니다. 시작 페이지가 "PeopleTracker"로 대체되었음을 알 수 있습니다. 또한 이 페이지에 {{outlet}} 을 (를) 추가했습니다. 즉, 중첩 된 경로가 해당 위치에 렌더링됩니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember detects the changed file and automatically reloads the page for you in the background. You should see that the welcome page has been replaced by "PeopleTracker". You also added an {{outlet}} to this page, which means that any route will be rendered in that place.

Ember developers have great options for how they handle data from back end APIs. Ember itself works with any type of back end: REST, JSON:API, GraphQL, or anything else. This guide will summarize how and where to make API requests. Follow the links within it to see examples and learn more.
Ember gives you the power to write tests and be productive from day one. You can be confident that your app will be correct today and years from now. A question remains: How should you write tests?
Ember gives you the ability to write your own helpers, to bring a minimum of logic into Ember templating.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 자신 만의 도우미 를 작성하여 최소한의 논리를 Ember 템플릿으로 가져올 수있는 기능을 제공합니다 .

trans-unit.source: Ember has a rich ecosystem of addons that can be easily added to projects. Addons provide a wide range of functionality to projects, often saving time and letting you focus on your project.
trans-unit.target: Ember에는 프로젝트에 쉽게 추가 할 수있는 풍부한 애드온 에코 시스템이 있습니다. 애드온은 프로젝트에 광범위한 기능을 제공하므로 시간을 절약하고 프로젝트에 집중할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember has and continues to support an implementation of a Proxy, which is a type of object that can wrap around other objects and intercept all of your gets and sets to them. Native JavaScript proxies allow you to do this without any special methods or syntax, but unfortunately they are not available in IE11. Since many Ember users must still support IE11, Ember's ObjectProxy class allows us to accomplish something similar.
Ember includes several helpers to facilitate acceptance testing. There are two types of helpers: asynchronous and synchronous.
trans-unit.target: Ember에는 승인 테스트를 용이하게하는 몇 가지 도우미가 포함되어 있습니다. 헬퍼에는 비동기 와 동기 의 두 가지 유형이 있습니다 .

trans-unit.source: Ember includes several helpers to facilitate application testing. There are two types of helpers: asynchronous and synchronous.

Ember is a JavaScript front-end framework designed to help you build websites with rich and complex user interactions. It does so by providing developers both with many features that are essential to manage complexity in modern web applications, as well as an integrated development toolkit that enables rapid iteration.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 풍부하고 복잡한 사용자 상호 작용으로 웹 사이트를 구축 할 수 있도록 설계된 JavaScript 프런트 엔드 프레임 워크입니다. 최신 웹 응용 프로그램의 복잡성을 관리하는 데 필요한 많은 기능과 빠른 반복을 가능하게하는 통합 개발 툴킷을 개발자에게 제공합니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember is a framework for building applications that run in the browser, which means that they are made with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It is very helpful to be familiar with these technologies. If you find yourself getting stuck or confused as you learn Ember, come back to this page and see if there is a general topic below that you could explore.

Ember is only able to infer the dynamic segments because the photo route is currently active. If we were to invoke the <LinkTo /> component for the same photos.photo.comment route, but from the photos route's template, it will result in an error, as we did not pass enough model objects to populate all the dynamic segments needed to generate the URL.

Ember keeps data for a page in an object called a model. To keep things simple at first, we'll populate the model for our rental listing page to use a hard-coded array of JavaScript objects. Later, we'll switch to using Ember Data, a library for robustly managing data in our app.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 페이지라는 데이터를 model 이라는 객체에 보관합니다 . 처음에는 단순하게 유지하기 위해 대여 목록 페이지의 모델을 채워서 하드 코딩 된 JavaScript 객체 배열을 사용합니다. 나중에 앱에서 데이터를 강력하게 관리하기위한 라이브러리 인 Ember Data 사용으로 전환 하겠습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember knows which subclass powers a component based on its filename. For example, if you have a component called blog-post, you would create a file at app/components/blog-post.js. If your component was called audio-player-controls, the file name would be at app/components/audio-player-controls.js.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 파일 이름을 기준으로 어떤 서브 클래스에 구성 요소를 제공하는지 알고 있습니다. 예를 들어 blog-post 라는 컴포넌트가 있으면 app/components/blog-post.js 에 파일을 작성합니다 . 컴포넌트가 audio-player-controls 이면 파일 이름은 app/components/audio-player-controls.js 입니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember makes use of these in places like the model hook for a route. Until the promise resolves, Ember is able to put the route into a "loading" state.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 라우트를위한 모델 훅과 같은 장소에서 이것을 사용합니다. 약속이 해결 될 때까지 Ember는 경로를 "로드 중"상태로 만들 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember manages the lifecycles and lifetimes of many built in constructs, such as components, and does so in a hierarchical way - when a parent component is destroyed, all of its children are destroyed as well.
Ember provides 3 types of tests out of the box:
Ember provides a browser extension and several configuration options to help you debug your application.
Ember provides a few ways to help developers more easily produce accessible applications, and this section of the guides will more explicitly assist with that.
Ember provides a number of decorators, such as the @tracked decorator, that will be described in greater detail later on in the guides.
Ember provides a variety of acceptance test helpers to make common tasks easier, such as visiting routes, filling in fields, clicking on links/buttons, and waiting for pages to display.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 경로 방문, 필드 작성, 링크 / 단추 클릭 및 페이지 표시 대기와 같은 일반적인 작업을 쉽게 수행 할 수 있도록 다양한 승인 테스트 도우미를 제공합니다.

Ember uses a technique called event delegation. This allows the framework to set up a global, shared event listener instead of requiring each view to do it manually. For example, instead of each view registering its own mousedown listener on its associated element, Ember sets up a mousedown listener on the body.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 이벤트 위임 이라는 기술을 사용합니다 . 이를 통해 프레임 워크는 각보기가 수동으로 수행하는 대신 글로벌 공유 이벤트 리스너를 설정할 수 있습니다. 예를 들어, 각 뷰 가 관련 요소에 자체 mousedown 리스너를 등록하는 대신 , Ember는 body 에 mousedown 리스너를 설정합니다 .

trans-unit.source: Ember uses templates to build up the user interface in an application.
Ember uses templates to organize the layout of HTML in an application.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 템플릿을 사용하여 응용 프로그램에서 HTML의 레이아웃을 구성합니다.

trans-unit.source: Ember uses the Handlebars templating library to power your app's user interface. Handlebars templates contain static HTML and dynamic content inside Handlebars expressions, which are invoked with double curly braces: {{}}.
trans-unit.target: Ember는 핸들 바 템플릿 라이브러리 를 사용하여 앱의 사용자 인터페이스를 강화합니다. 핸들 바 템플릿에는 핸들 바 표현식 내부에 정적 HTML 및 동적 컨텐츠가 포함되며, 이중 중괄호 {{}} 로 호출됩니다 .

trans-unit.source: Ember utilities are reusable code that can be accessed from various parts of the application. For Super Rentals, we'll use a utility to access the Google Maps API. trans-unit.source: Ember's approach to handling asynchronous logic in the router makes heavy use of the concept of Promises. In short, promises are objects that represent an eventual value. A promise can either fulfill (successfully resolve the value) or reject (fail to resolve the value). The way to retrieve this eventual value, or handle the cases when the promise rejects, is via the promise's then() method, which accepts two optional callbacks, one for fulfillment and one for rejection. If the promise fulfills, the fulfillment handler gets called with the fulfilled value as its sole argument, and if the promise rejects, the rejection handler gets called with a reason for the rejection as its sole argument. For example:
trans-unit.target: 라우터에서 비동기 로직을 ​​처리하는 Ember의 접근 방식은 약속 개념을 많이 사용합니다. 간단히 말해, 약속은 최종 가치를 나타내는 객체입니다. 약속은 값을 이행 (성공적으로 해결)하거나 거부 (값을 해결하지 못함 ) 할 수 있습니다 . 이 최종 값을 검색하거나 약속이 거부되는 경우를 처리하는 방법 은 promise의 then() 메소드를 사용하는 것입니다.이 메소드는 이행 및 거부에 대한 두 가지 선택적 콜백을 허용합니다. 약속이 이행되면 이행 핸들러는 이행 된 값을 유일한 인수로 호출하고 약속이 거부하면 거부 이유를 거부 인수로 단독 호출합니다. 예를 들면 다음과 같습니다.

Ember.js Guides

Ember.js is a productive, battle-tested JavaScript framework for building modern web applications. It includes everything you need to build rich UIs that work on any device. It does so by providing developers many features that are essential to manage complexity in modern web applications, as well as an integrated development toolkit that enables rapid iteration.

Ember.js itself works with any type of back end: REST, JSON:API, GraphQL, or anything else. To learn about other ways to handle data and to find extensions, check out the guide for making API requests, look for plugins on Ember Observer, and search for community-made tutorials.

trans-unit.source: Enabling At Runtime

Enabling this feature makes template-only components more consistent with angle-bracket invocation and with Glimmer components. Additionally it improves the performance of template-only components (there is no JS object instantiated to provide context) and makes them an excellent replacement for use of Ember's more complex and now discouraged API {{partial.
Enabling this feature will result in only the contents of the template being rendered, and additionally in no classic Ember component instance being instantiated to provide it context.

Event handlers on Classic components, such as click() and mouseEnter(). These APIs still work without the integration enabled, but they no longer receive a jQuery event, they receive a native Event instead. You can convert to using native events incrementally by using the ember-jquery-legacy addon, which provides a function that converts a jQuery event into a native event safely. Once all of your event handlers have been converted, you can disable jQuery integration.

Events
Events and Flags

Events are named functions that are invoked when sent to a record. The record will first look for a method with the given name on the current state. If no method is found, it will search the current state's parent, and then its grandparent, and so on until reaching the top of the hierarchy. If the root is reached without an event handler being found, an exception will be raised. This can be very helpful when debugging new features.
trans-unit.target: 이벤트는 레코드로 전송 될 때 호출되는 함수로 명명됩니다. 레코드는 먼저 현재 상태에서 주어진 이름을 가진 메소드를 찾습니다. 메소드를 찾지 못하면 계층 구조의 맨 위에 도달 할 때까지 현재 상태의 부모와 조부모 등을 검색합니다. 이벤트 핸들러를 찾지 않고 루트에 도달하면 예외가 발생합니다. 새로운 기능을 디버깅 할 때 매우 유용합니다.

trans-unit.source: Events are sent by the record or its store to the record's currentState property. How the state reacts to these events is dependent on which state it is in. In some states, certain events will be invalid and will cause an exception to be raised.
trans-unit.target: 레코드 또는 해당 저장소에서 이벤트를 레코드의 currentState 속성 으로 보냅니다 . 상태가 이러한 이벤트에 반응하는 방식은 상태에 따라 다릅니다. 일부 상태에서는 특정 이벤트가 유효하지 않아 예외가 발생합니다.

trans-unit.source: Events should transition to a different state if appropriate. This can be done by calling the record's transitionTo() method with a path to the desired state. The state manager will attempt to resolve the state path relative to the current state. If no state is found at that path, it will attempt to resolve it relative to the current state's parent, and then its parent, and so on until the root is reached. trans-unit.target: 필요한 경우 이벤트가 다른 상태로 전환되어야합니다. 이것은 원하는 상태로의 경로와 함께 레코드의 transitionTo() 메소드를 호출하여 수행 할 수 있습니다 . 상태 관리자는 현재 상태를 기준으로 상태 경로를 확인하려고 시도합니다. 해당 경로에서 상태를 찾을 수 없으면 루트에 도달 할 때까지 현재 상태의 상위와 상위에 상대적인 상태를 해결하려고 시도합니다. 예를 들어 다음과 같은 계층 구조를 상상해보십시오.

Extending Adapters is a natural process in Ember Data. Ember takes the position that you should extend an adapter to add different functionality. This results in code that is more testable, easier to understand and reduces bloat for people who may want to subclass your adapter.

Fields are assigned before any code in the constructor method is run, which is why we can rely on them being assigned correctly by the time it runs. As with methods, fields do not exist on the class itself, nor do they exist on the class's prototype, they only exist on the instance of the class. However, they can be added to the class directly using the static keyword, which is described in more detail below.

Fields are assigned before any code in the constructor method is run, which is why we can rely on them being assigned correctly by the time it runs. Fields do not exist on the class itself, nor do they exist on the class's prototype, they only exist on the instance of the class. However, they can be added to the class directly using the static keyword, like other class elements.

trans-unit.source: Finally, if your application receives and sends data, you want to guarantee that you can take these actions successfully. You also want to prove that you can handle the error states correctly. Application tests are a great place to check these, since you have to interact with the app just like the user would.

Finally, in order for application tests to work, you must call setupApplicationTest() and pass the hooks object. In addition to the usual goodness of setupTest(), this method creates an application instance so that you can test the app from an end-user perspective. It also lets you use test helpers for routing and DOM interaction, such as currentURL, visit, click, and fillIn.

First, it is important to make sure that the type name of a record in the normalized JSON object exactly matches the filename of the model defined for this record type. By convention Model names are singular in Ember Data, however, the example type names shown in the JSON API spec are pluralized. The JSON API spec itself is agnostic about inflection rules, however, Ember Data's own JSONAPISerializer assumes types are plural and it will automatically singularize the types.
trans-unit.target: 먼저 정규화 된 JSON 객체의 레코드 type 이름이이 레코드 유형에 정의 된 모델의 파일 ​​이름과 정확히 일치 하는지 확인해야합니다 . 일반적으로 Ember Data에서 모델 이름은 단수이지만 JSON API 사양에 표시된 예제 유형 이름 은 복수형입니다. JSON API 사양 자체는 변곡 규칙에 대해 독립적이지만 Ember Data의 자체 JSONAPISerializer 는 유형이 복수라고 가정하고 유형을 자동으로 단일화합니다.

trans-unit.source: First, it is important to make sure that the type name of a record in the normalized JSON object exactly matches the filename of the model defined for this record type. By convention Model names are singular in Ember Data, however, the example type names shown in the JSON:API spec are pluralized. The JSON:API spec itself is agnostic about inflection rules, however, Ember Data's own JSONAPISerializer assumes types are plural and it will automatically singularize the types.

For many Octane features, there are codemods available as well, so be sure to read our Upgrade Strategy Guide before making changes like these by hand.

For many of the optional features, the thing they affect the most is what you see in your newly-created files, not within your existing code. Your app will keep working, even if you haven't refactored code to use Octane's features yet. Making new files in the Octane style is good place to start, but eventually you should refactor existing code so that your app follows one main programming model, not a mixture of Octane and Classic. Following a refactoring plan will help with onboarding new developers, and minimize flipping back and forth between different versions of the Ember Guides.

For the most part, you should be able to build Ember applications without directly manipulating the DOM. Before considering directly accessing the DOM, it's always best to first consider whether there's an Ember-native way to accomplish your goal.

For the remainder of this page, we'll give you an introduction to testing in Ember and get you set up to add tests as we implement pieces of our app. On subsequent tutorial pages, the final sections of each page will be devoted to adding a test for the feature you just implemented. These sections aren't required for a working application and you may move on with the tutorial without writing them.

Framework objects in an Ember application (components, services, routes, etc.) are created via a factory and dependency injection system. Each of these objects is the responsibility of an "owner", which handled its instantiation and manages its lifetime.
trans-unit.target: Ember 어플리케이션의 프레임 워크 객체 (컴포넌트, 서비스, 라우트 등)는 팩토리 및 의존성 주입 시스템을 통해 생성됩니다. 이러한 각 개체는 인스턴스화를 처리하고 수명을 관리하는 "소유자"의 책임입니다.

Generally, Services are Ember's primary method for sharing state via dependency injection. In most cases, you shouldn't need to learn about how to work with Ember's DI system directly, or how to manually register and setup dependencies. However, there are times when it may be necessary. This guide covers the details of the system, and how to use it when needed.

Generally, you should try to create classes with their tracked properties enumerated and decorated with @tracked, instead of relying on dynamically created POJOs. In some cases however, if your usage of properties on POJOs is too dynamic, you may not be able to enumerate every single property that could be tracked. There could be a prohibitive number of possible properties, or there could be no way to know them in advance. In this case, it's recommended that you reset the value wherever it is updated:
